title: What is this font?
content:
Can anyone please identify this font? Looks like Times New Roman to me but need to confirm.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924020901/http:/typophile.com/files/1_21.jpg) | 71.33 KB |
author: sunnyjamiel

comments.content:
It could be Times, yes.

[Please use a descriptive title next time! Thank you.](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924020901/http:/typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq/#Q_2)

it’s too devolved to be simply times ’whatever’, it’s a typeset block from long time ago. you can get the same look with ursa or gentium printed (not photocopied) on a rough paper, high cotton content or laid stock.

In the spirit of unbridled creativity,

Troy Vera  
Kingdom Graphics  
 [http://www.kingdomgraphics.biz](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924020901/http:/www.kingdomgraphics.biz/ "http://www.kingdomgraphics.biz")  
Yahoo IM: kingdom\_graphics  
Skype: kingdom\_graphics

I’m curious to know more about the sample. Is it actual (metal) type, and how old is it? If you have samples of other letters it might be possible to give a more definite ID.

- Mike Yanega
